metadata.title: CVE-2017-14173 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the function ReadTXTImage() in coders/txt.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-10, aninteger overflow might occur for the addition operation"GetQuantumRange(depth)+1" when "depth" is large, producing a smaller valuethan expected. As a result, an infinite loop would occur for a crafted TXTfile that claims a very large "max_value" value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
